title: U.S. challenges Indian export subsidies at WTO - official
text: March 14, 2018 / 5:32 PM / Updated 40 minutes ago U.S. challenges Indian export subsidies at WTO - official Reuters Staff 1 Min Read WASHINGTON (Reuters) - The United States launched a challenge on Wednesday at the World Trade Organization to Indian export subsidies, saying they hurt U.S. manufacturers by letting Indian exporters sell goods more cheaply, U.S. Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer said. File Photo: U.S. Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer arrives at the European Commission headquarters ahead of a meeting with Japan's Minister of Economy, Trade and Industry Hiroshige Seko and European Trade Commissioner Cecilia Malmstrom, to discuss steel overcapacity, in Brussels, Belgium March 10, 2018. REUTERS/Francois Walschaerts “These export subsidy programmes harm American workers by creating an uneven playing field on which they must compete,” Lighthizer said in a statement. Reporting by David Alexander; Editing by Tom Brown
